TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:
How does this look?

<iframe data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?app=core&module=system&controller=embed&url=http://imgur.com/a/iMkkh" style="height:453px;"></iframe>

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, Drew Kerman said:
> 
> 
> I don't think it's worth the extra effort that would go with having to keep track of it separately, but that would be your call. From a user standpoint, I went back to 1.1.3 just so I could get one photo from an IVA using this setting and I did notice it affected the ground somewhat if it was set too low, so just having it as a value people can play with within Scatterer (since its Scatterer that would be causing any ground/water flickering) seems to make the most sense. Keeping all problems in one place and all that.
> 

Ok, no problem.

I now have to check, if one can configure some kind of backback with ballast to keep a kerbal submerged. Maybe with <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>. This looks really great!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-04-22T23:44:14Z" title="04/22/2017 11:44  PM" data-short="7 yr">April 22, 2017</time> by Avera9eJoe**

Probably asked before, so sorry in advance.

I use the latest eve + latest scattere and I tracked down the cloud-fix (new dlls for eve). Stil my <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> is a white ball with this mod ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")

Further: If I use the "fixed" dlls I get 0 clouds. Without them I get clouds and no other issues but the "white ball".

Can anybody help? What could you need to help me? Logs, screens etc?! I really love this mod and since my oceans aren't a mess anymore I would love to use it - badly.

cheers

[@maculator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/122127-maculator/) Do you have a set of cloud configs installed? (BoulderCo, Stock Visual Enhancements, <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr>, etc.)

I have the [stock configs](https://github.com/WazWaz/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/releases) installed.

And the fix from this post:

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/51142-1121-1-2-may-13-2016-environmentalvisualenhancements/&page=260&do=embed&comment=2774007&embedComment=2774007&embedDo=findComment#comment-2774007"></iframe>

BUT Im, as mentioned, confused. Because this fix just terminates all my clouds ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/") So yeah <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> isn't a white ball anymore, but no clouds at all.

i haven't tried the newest version of <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> yet (in fact didn't know a new one was released). The fixed files you see above are for a very old release (september), you don't need them for the newer versions.

The current scatterer cloud integration is meant for the version of <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> released in october (second one in the downloads above). Maybe get that one or disable the cloud integration from scatterer and see if it helps. You don't need the fixed dlls

Okay so I'll try to disable the cloud integration and if that doesn't work I'll get the second version in the github and install this. I'll report back, thanks

Turn that option off and it should be fine... hopefully?

Let us know how it goes.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-04-23T11:11:15Z" title="04/23/2017 11:11  AM" data-short="7 yr">April 23, 2017</time> by maculator**
  
reasons

So thanks at all for trying to help, but even when I install SVE and stick 110% to the install instructions it won't work with either settings. Eve just refuses to be beautiful, I'll quit and stay stock ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
Do you have OpenGL enabled in steam?
No. I use the normal x64 version over steam. No start parameters.

Question about contact foam. Will there be an adjustable parameter for the amplitude and decay of the foam? And could it somehow be dependent on speed of the collider moving over the surface? That way we could have trails behind ships. :-)  

I understand however, a bow wave would be difficult.

> 
> 
> 13 minutes ago, maculator said:
> 
> 
> No. I use the normal x64 version over steam. No start parameters.
> 

Sorry I thought you had the white ball not the purple ball?

Can I see a screen and a log? Also try starting in dx11 or opengl if you haven't already.

> 
> 
> 10 minutes ago, Azimech said:
> 
> 
> Question about contact foam. Will there be an adjustable parameter for the amplitude and decay of the foam? And could it somehow be dependent on speed of the collider moving over the surface? That way we could have trails behind ships. :-)  
>   
> 
> I understand however, a bow wave would be difficult.
> 

It's nothing that elaborate, at the moment it's just checking the depth buffer to see how close the surface is behind it. ie it doesn't leave a trail after a ship has moved, so no such a thing as decay or collider checking or anything.

You can see it here around the base of the plane: [https://vid.me/zP0x](https://vid.me/zP0x)

If the plane moves there appears to be a bit of foam around where it touches the water but it will not leave a trail, that's a bit more complicated.

[@maculator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/122127-maculator/) Have you checked the version number in the scatterer screen in game menu? Strangely, both DL links in the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>, Mega and SpaceDock, offer a zip named scatterer-0.0300.zip, but both of them show "Scatterer v0.0275 preview". After noticing that when installing <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">SVE</abbr> 1.2, I took (only!) scatterer from the last bundled version ([https://github.com/Galileo88/StockVisualEnhancements/releases/tag/v1.1.6)](https://github.com/Galileo88/StockVisualEnhancements/releases/tag/v1.1.6) from which I remembered that it came with v0.0300. I did not try<abbr> S</abbr><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">VE</abbr> 1.2.2 yet. Hope this helps!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-04-23T15:37:37Z" title="04/23/2017 03:37  PM" data-short="7 yr">April 23, 2017</time> by maculator**
  
happyness

So I'm in need of some testers for the new effects.

Things to keep in mind for this (preview) version:

-New effects include: Water refraction and depth-based transparency, contact foam and underwater surface and "fog", there are some new parameters in the ocean tab to control them  

-If you disable refraction, underwater effects may not work, this will be fixed.  

-Ocean lights compatibility will break all the new effects, disable it for now. This will be fixed.  

-Sunflares still render underwater, this will be fixed.  

-From orbits around 70-160km, when you have refractions on, you might see outlines around the shore, this will be fixed.  

-I haven't made configs for laythe or <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> oceans so they'll get the default values.  

-The setting for alternate SQRT is removed, it should not be needed anymore, please report if you still get issues with the "leaking halo" around planets.  

-There used to be a very obvious line around 300m in front of the camera where the postprocessing effect starts, this is fixed.  

-I haven't tested with <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> or any other mods, I expect the clouds might be visible through the underwater surface, please tell me if this is the case.  

-NearClipPlane parameter is back in the config file, I don't recommend messing with it.  

-When the camera is just at the water surface level there may be some artifacting, a bit lower or higher everything should work well.

Report any new issues and let me know what you think of the new features.

Have fun

[https://mega.nz/#!KBgjhQgY!A3ccBD_YyURyanNrmu9i2DTNXuM3-KKQ8-Wu11Z7PwM](https://mega.nz/#!KBgjhQgY!A3ccBD_YyURyanNrmu9i2DTNXuM3-KKQ8-Wu11Z7PwM)
